conclusion: Analyze the flow paths created by the color-coded streams to determine which container the liquid will flow into.
A (Green) flows downward and moves toward the left side of the image, guided by yellow and gray baffles.
A (Green) is led towards the purple container (E).
B (Yellow) flows downward, directed by yellow and gray baffles.
B (Yellow) is directed toward the purple container (E).
C (White) flows downward, directed by gray and white baffles.
C (White) is directed toward the purple container (E).
D (Blue) flows downward, directed by white and blue baffles.
D (Blue) is directed toward the yellow container (F).
Liquids A, B, and C flow into container E.
Liquid D flows into container F.
Final answer: Liquid from D will flow into container F; liquids from A, B, and C will flow into container E.
